cycloneMessage.issuingUnit: NWS NATIONAL HURRICANE CENTER MIAMI FL
cycloneMessage.systemGeoRefPt1: ABOUT 505 MI...810 KM SW OF PUNTA EUGENIA MEXICO
cycloneMessage.message:
ZCZC MIATCPEP5 ALL TTAA00 KNHC DDHHMM
BULLETIN Tropical Storm Eugene Advisory Number 19 NWS National Hurricane Center Miami FL EP052017 200 AM PDT Wed Jul 12 2017
...EUGENE EXPECTED TO BECOME A REMNANT LOW LATER TODAY...
SUMMARY OF 200 AM PDT...0900 UTC...INFORMATION ---------------------------------------------- LOCATION...22.9N 121.1W ABOUT 505 MI...810 KM SW OF PUNTA EUGENIA MEXICO MAXIMUM SUSTAINED WINDS...40 MPH...65 KM/H PRESENT MOVEMENT...NW OR 320 DEGREES AT 9 MPH...15 KM/H MINIMUM CENTRAL PRESSURE...1005 MB...29.68 INCHES
WATCHES AND WARNINGS -------------------- There are no coastal watches or warnings in effect.
DISCUSSION AND 48-HOUR OUTLOOK ------------------------------ At 200 AM PDT (0900 UTC), the center of Tropical Storm Eugene was located near latitude 22.9 North, longitude 121.1 West. Eugene is moving toward the northwest near 9 mph (15 km/h), and this general motion is expected to continue through Thursday night.
Maximum sustained winds have decreased to near 40 mph (65 km/h) with higher gusts. Additional weakening is forecast during the next couple of days, and Eugene is expected to degenerate into a remnant low later today.
Tropical-storm-force winds extend outward up to 60 miles (95 km) from the center.
The estimated minimum central pressure is 1005 mb (29.68 inches).
HAZARDS AFFECTING LAND ---------------------- SURF: Swells generated by Eugene are affecting portions of the west coast of the Baja California peninsula and southern California. These swells are likely to cause life-threatening surf and rip current conditions. Please consult products from your local weather office.
NEXT ADVISORY ------------- Next complete advisory at 800 AM PDT.
$$ Forecaster Berg
NNNN
